snippet: When Jack Yantis went to the scene of a crash involving one of his bulls, he was shot by sheriff’s deputies. Much about what happened is unclear.
abstract: Anger and doubt linger among local residents in wake of death of cattle rancher Jack Yantis, who was shot and killed by Adams County deputies after he responded to call that one of his bulls had been hit by vehicle on local highway; Yantis's wife Donna, ordered to ground by officers, suffered a heart attack at scene; federal and state officials, including Federal Bureau of Investigation, have begun inquiry but much remains unclear.
lead_paragraph: When Jack Yantis went to the scene of a crash involving one of his bulls, he was shot by sheriff’s deputies. Much about what happened is unclear.

headline.main: Anger and Doubt Rise After Idaho Man’s Fatal Encounter With Deputies
headline.print_headline: Anger and Doubt Rise in Idaho After Man’s Fatal Encounter With Deputies
